conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team. I’m Student_C and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be excited to commit and contribute to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B. I am ranked 3rd in School_B's priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B). If I delay, higher-priority students may take the only seat. Applying immediately maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before the seat is filled.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for placing School_B as your first choice. We appreciate your interest in our academic environment and community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_C is #3 on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_E and Student_B). However, Student_C is applying now and states School_B is first choice, making acceptance likely to secure a match immediately. Holding out for Student_E or Student_B is risky: Student_E ranks School_B last and will likely never apply; Student_B ranks School_A first and may not apply to School_B unless rejected elsewhere. Given quota=1 and the benefit of locking in a relatively high-priority student, accept Student_C now rather than risk ending unmatched or with a lower-ranked option later.

conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_A is my first-choice school because I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute consistently in class and school activities. If admitted, I would commit enthusiastically and make School_A my top priority. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply there immediately. Although School_A ranks me relatively low (4th), early application is still my best shot at my first choice before I get locked out elsewhere. I will signal strong commitment and fit to maximize acceptance chances.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for sharing why School_A is your first choice. After reviewing applications received in this round and given our very limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from B, A, D, E. School_A true priority ranks: E (1st), D (2nd), A (3rd), B (4th), C (5th). To maximize outcome, accept the highest-ranked applicant available now: Student_E. Accepting B would block a better match. Since students apply simultaneously and acceptance finalizes a match, we should reject B this round.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions committee—I'm Student_A. I’m very interested in School_A because of its strong academic environment and fit for my goals. If admitted, I would be excited to enroll and contribute fully to the school community. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I have the lowest priority there, so an early [APPLY] would almost surely be rejected if higher-priority students apply. At School_A I have relatively strong priority (3rd), and School_A is still high on my true list (3rd). Since Student_B ranks School_A first and Student_E ranks School_A third, I should move quickly to secure a solid match by applying to School_A now.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing the applications received this round and given our very limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the matching process.

Since Student_E (my top choice) has applied and is available, accepting Student_A now would prevent me from matching with a higher-priority student. Therefore I should reject Student_A this round to preserve capacity for Student_E.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_D. I’m very interested in joining School_A because I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute positively to the school community. School_A is one of my top choices, and if admitted I would be excited to commit. Thank you for considering my application.

Those students also have School_B very high, so applying now is likely to be rejected. My next choice is School_C, where I am ranked 3rd; however Student_B and Student_C rank above me there and also like School_C. School_A is my 3rd choice, and importantly School_A ranks me 2nd (only behind Student_E). Student_E’s top choices are School_C then School_D, so there is a good chance Student_E won’t apply to School_A immediately. Therefore, applying to School_A in round 1 gives me a strong chance to secure a relatively high-ranked match rather than risking rejection cycles at B/C and ending up lower later.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing the applications received this round and given our very limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: As School_A (quota 1), my true priority ranking is E > D > A > B > C. In this round I received APPLY messages from B, A, D, and E. Since Student_E is my top priority and has applied, I should reserve my single seat for Student_E. Accepting Student_D now would prevent matching with Student_E, which is strictly worse for my objective. Therefore I must reject Student_D despite D being my second priority.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions committee—I'm Student_E. I’m very excited about the possibility of joining School_A and would like to formally apply. I believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community, and I’m ready to commit if accepted. Thank you for your consideration.

With capacity 1, School_C is very likely to accept one of those higher-priority applicants if they apply. By contrast, at School_A I am ranked 1st, and School_A is my 3rd true choice—still a strong outcome. To maximize my chance of securing a high-ranked match early (and avoid ending up forced down my list), I will apply to School_A immediately, where I should be accepted if I apply now.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. We believe you would be an excellent fit for our community, and we look forward to having you join us.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A’s true priority list, and we have quota 1. Student_E has applied and indicated readiness to commit if accepted. Although Student_E ranks School_A third (after School_C and School_D), an immediate acceptance secures our top-choice student and avoids the risk of losing them to other schools where they also have strong priority positions (e.g., School_B ranks E #1; School_D ranks E #4; School_C ranks E #4). Given the one-shot accept/reject structure for an [APPLY] and our objective to match as high as possible on our priority list, we should accept Student_E now.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B and I’m formally applying. School_C is one of my top choices, and I’m especially excited by the strong academic culture and the chance to contribute through consistent effort in class and active participation in school life. If admitted, I will accept promptly and commit fully to School_C. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and is now presumably matched. Among remaining schools, School_C is highest on my true preference list (A>B>C>D>E) and also ranks me #1 in its priority list, giving me the best chance to secure a strong match immediately. I will apply now with a clear commitment and fit statement to convert that priority into an acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you’ll be a strong fit for our academic community, and we look forward to having you contribute in and out of the classroom.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority ranking is B > C > D > E > A, and I have quota 1. In this round I have [APPLY] from Student_B and Student_D, and [TALK] from Student_A. Student_B is my top-ranked student overall, so accepting now guarantees my best possible match and removes risk of losing B to School_A or School_B (both ranked above C in B’s preferences). Waiting to compare with other applicants cannot improve upon the top choice, so I should accept Student_B immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions team—I'm Student_A. School_C is one of my top choices because I’m looking for a rigorous academic environment and a community where I can contribute consistently. Could you share what you prioritize most when choosing among applicants (e.g., academic fit, specific interests, commitment to enroll)? If there’s any information that would be helpful for me to provide, I’d be glad to share it.
conversation.thought: My top choice (School_B) and second choice (School_C) are preferred, but School_B is no longer available. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_C is my highest true preference. However, School_C’s priority list ranks me last, so a direct [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply this round. I will use [TALK] to express strong interest, learn what they value, and position myself as a committed candidate, while keeping flexibility to apply elsewhere next round if needed.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for reaching out and for your interest in School_C. In our review process, we primarily prioritize overall academic fit and readiness for our curriculum, sustained engagement and contribution to the school community (in and out of class), and clarity of interest/commitment to School_C.

At the moment, our available seat is filled, so we are not in a position to invite or encourage additional applications for immediate consideration. If circumstances change and capacity opens, we would be happy to reconnect.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Quota is already filled with Student_B, who is #1 on School_C’s true priority list and has already been accepted/matched. Student_A is last on our priority list, and in any case Student_A has only initiated [TALK], not [APPLY]. With quota 0, we should not encourage an application we cannot accept; best response is to provide general selection criteria and transparently note that our seat is currently filled, while leaving a narrow possibility to reconnect only if capacity changes.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D and I’m writing to formally apply. If offered admission, I’m ready to commit and would be excited to join School_C. Thank you for your consideration.

I also have relatively strong priority at School_C (3rd), so applying now gives a good chance before capacity fills. I will send a clear commitment-style application.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we are not able to offer you admission.

We wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,

[REJECT]

Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new APPLY. Therefore reject Student_D while noting capacity is filled.
